comments:
(Note: Eclipse 2.1.2 with AMD64 patch works on this system.) 
 
During splash the following appears in a pop-up window: 
   JVM terminated. Exit code=1 
   /usr/lib/java/bin/java 
   -cp /home/dash/archives/eclipse/I20040319/amd64-gtk2/eclipse/./startup.jar 
org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main 
   -os linux 
   -ws gtk 
   -arch amd64 
   -showsplash /home/dash/archives/eclipse/I20040319/amd64-gtk2/eclipse/./
eclipse -showsplash 600 
   -shared /home/dash/archives/eclipse/I20040319/amd64-gtk2/eclipse/./eclipse 
-shared 448006 
   -vm /usr/lib/java/bin/java 
   -vmargs 
   -cp /home/dash/archives/eclipse/I20040319/amd64-gtk2/eclipse/./startup.jar 
org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main  
 
This is on a clean install from the zip file, first (and subsequent) 
runs.  After closing the dialog the splash remains until the eclipse process is 
killed. 
The problem is reproducible.  There is no workplace/.metadata.log file. 
 
System details: 
O/S	Suse 9.0 
Kernel	2.4.21-201-smp 
gtk2	2.2.3-46 
CPU	Dual Opteron 246 
RAM	2GB 
Java:	java version "1.4.2-rc1" 
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build Blackdown-1.4.2-rc1) 
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build Blackdown-1.4.2-rc1, mixed mode) 
 
Let me know if anyone would like more info.
Moving to SWT. I believe this port is still in progress.

I am experiencing the same problem running on a Red Hat Enterprise Linux AS
machine with the following specs: 
AMD Opteron(tm) Processor 846
gtk2-2.2.4-4.0
kernel-smp-2.4.21-11.EL
Blackdown 1.4.2-rc1 for AMD64

This happens with any one of the integration builds for Linux (AMD 64/GTK 2), as
well as 3.0M8. The strange thing is eclipse spontatneously started once after
removing the configuration directory, but I haven't been able to reproduce this.
As I understand, other people can run any one of these builds with no problems.
 I am getting the following log trace:

!SESSION Apr 06, 2004 12:39:46.37 ----------------------------------------------
java.version=1.4.2-rc1
java.vendor=Blackdown Java-Linux Team
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=amd64, WS=gtk, NL=en_US
!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi Apr 06, 2004 12:39:46.40
!MESSAGE Application error
!STACK 1
java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to locate application extension:
org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench
        at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run(PlatformActivator.java:263)
        at
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:239)
        at
org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:117)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at
sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
        at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:267)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:692)
        at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:676)
 
Any ideas how I can fix this?
Thanks,
Peter

Peter:

Are you observing this problem with a clean M8 install (unzip into a new 
folder, no previous workspace)? If so, can you run eclipse with the following:
eclipse -vmargs -verbose
And paste the console output. Thanks!

I was experiencing the problem with a clean M8 install. When I ran with -vmargs
-verbose I got:

[faltaous@torrent eclipse]$ ./eclipse -vm ~/Blackdown_JVM/j2sdk1.4.2/bin/java
-vmargs -verbose
[Opened /home/faltaous/Blackdown_JVM/j2sdk1.4.2/jre/lib/rt.jar]

Then it would just hang. However I tried running with LD_ASSUME_KERNEL=2.4.1 and
that seemed to do the trick (although I did have to wipe out my configuration
directory). Now, it runs okay with LD_ASSUME_KERNEL=2.4.1 so I'm guessing it was
a JVM problem (Although this is still strange since I never set LD_ASSUME_KERNEL
before and got it to start up randomly a couple fo times). 
Thanks for your time.

>Then it would just hang.
Yes I have observed this too on one of our 2 boxes. The JVM just does not seem 
to like the -verbose flag on some configurations (completely unrelated to 
Eclipse/SWT).

> However I tried running with LD_ASSUME_KERNEL=2.4.1 and
>that seemed to do the trick (although I did have to wipe out my configuration
>directory). Now, it runs okay with LD_ASSUME_KERNEL=2.4.1
Thanks for the info. Yes, once something went wrong with Eclipse, one often 
has to wipe out the config directory. Please continue to report crashes...

Hello,

I think, i may have the same problem. Or it's a different bug, but i hope
someone could help me. Thank's Christian

The two original reporters are both are on SMP x86-64 machines, which leads me
to believe that the crash may have been specific to this configuration. 
However, since there is no VM crash log posted here I cannot investigate it
further.  Given that these crashes were with pre-3.0 releases, I am going to
close this bug as WORKSFORME.  Please file a new bug if you have a crash with
3.0 final.

The problem with -verbose not working seems pretty strange, but unrelated to the
original crashes.  Christian, does eclipse start OK if you do not use -vmargs
-verbose ?  Regardless, I think you should file a new bug against Platform SWT
with this information.  Thanks!

Peter, the "Unable to locate application extension" error definitely has to do
with deleting the configuration area, so this is also a separate issue.  If you
are still seeing weirdness like that, please open a new bug against Platform
Runtime.

Sorry this got confusing. hopefully next time we can actually fix something. :)

traces.message: Unable to locate application extension: org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench
